A preparative for the fast, or, a sovereigne balsome for the cure of the distempers of the times. Weall, Job, 17th cent.
[2], 16, [2] p.
Printed by A. N. for Richard Lownds, at his shop adjoyning to Ludgate, London : 1642.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "By Job Weall apothecary". Signed: I. W. [i.e. Job Weall]. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
